{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has a several day history of edema, which suggests nephrotic syndrome. The lab studies show hypoalbuminemia (1.9 g/dL), hypercholesterolemia (not mentioned but implied by the presence of fatty casts), and proteinuria (4+). This points towards minimal change disease as the most likely diagnosis. Additionally, the patient has Hodgkin's lymphoma which can be associated with minimal change nephropathy as seen in the document 'Spontaneously remitting minimal change nephropathy preceding a relapse of Hodgkin's disease by 19 months'.", "answer_choice": "C"}
